14. When. As if he should have said, But the apostles, who, as is said above, ver. 1, tarried at Jerusalem when the rest of the faithful were scattered abroad from thence, being informed of the conversion of the Samaritans unto the faith of Christ, sent Peter and John out of their company unto Samaria, by consent of them all, to the end that they might lay their hands on the Samaritans, and so might give them the singular gifts of the Holy Spirst, as appears by that which follows. By the way, hence we may see that Peter was not a monarch of the apostolical college and of the whole church, for the ambassador uses not to be greater and higher than he that sends him.
